meanings.definition: A person who constantly finds fault or complains.
meanings.sent1: The carper always has something negative to say.
meanings.sent2: My aunt is a carper who never seems satisfied with anything.
meanings.sent3: The carper at the party kept pointing out flaws in the decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her critical eye made her the carper of the group.
meanings.sent5: The carper's constant complaints made everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: To find fault or complain constantly.
meanings.sent1: Please don't carper about every little detail.
meanings.sent2: He tends to carper about the service at restaurants.
meanings.sent3: She would carper about the weather even on sunny days.
meanings.sent4: The child's tendency to carper made his parents weary.
meanings.sent5: Try not to carper too much, it can be exhausting for everyone around you.
